intro: Gesnouinia arborea, commonly known as the tree of the forest, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters, featuring a broad, spreading canopy and smooth, gray bark. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a glossy green surface. Its small, fragrant flowers are borne in clusters and are pollinated by insects, while its fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds. Gesnouinia arborea plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
